title: Problem Overview
content:
**Erdős Problem #1114:**

For a polynomial f with roots in arithmetic progression, the gaps between consecutive critical points of f' increase outward from the midpoint.

**Setup:**
- f has roots a₀, a₀+d, a₀+2d, ..., a₀+nd
- By Rolle, f' has n critical points
- Gaps gᵢ = cᵢ₊₁ - cᵢ

**Result:** Gaps increase as we move from center to endpoints.

**Status:** SOLVED by Bálint (1960)

title: IsAPRoots
content:
**Arithmetic Progression Roots:**

The roots are a₀, a₀+d, a₀+2d, ..., a₀+nd for d > 0.

This is the special structure that enables the theorem.

title: HasAPRoots
content:
**Polynomial with AP Roots:**

f(x) = c · (x - a₀)(x - (a₀+d))···(x - (a₀+nd))

A polynomial of degree n+1 with n+1 evenly spaced roots.

title: Rolle's Theorem Application
content:
**Rolle Gives Critical Points:**

Between any two consecutive roots of f, there's a root of f'.

So f' has exactly n distinct real roots c₁ < c₂ < ... < cₙ in (a₀, aₙ).

title: Gap
content:
**Gap Definition:**

gᵢ = cᵢ₊₁ - cᵢ

The distance between consecutive critical points.

title: Midpoint
content:
**Midpoint of Root Interval:**

m = a₀ + nd/2

The center of the interval containing all roots.

title: Bálint's Theorem
content:
**Main Theorem (Bálint 1960):**

If |cᵢ - m| < |cⱼ - m| (cᵢ is closer to midpoint), then gᵢ < gⱼ.

The gaps increase as we move outward from the center.

This is the core result of Problem #1114.

title: Symmetric Formulation
content:
**Alternate Statement:**

Outer gaps ≥ inner gaps.

g₁ > g₂ > ... > g_{middle} < ... < g_{n-2} < g_{n-1}

The gaps form a "U-shape" pattern.

title: Quartic Case
content:
**n = 4 Example:**

f has 5 roots, f' has 4 critical points.

Gaps: g₁, g₂, g₃

Result: g₁ > g₂ and g₃ > g₂ (outer > middle).

title: Symmetry Property
content:
**Symmetry of AP Polynomial:**

f(a₀ + t) = (-1)^{n+1} f(aₙ - t) (up to scaling).

The polynomial is symmetric about its center, which induces structure on f'.

title: Convexity Argument
content:
**Key Proof Technique:**

Certain auxiliary functions are convex, which implies the monotonicity of gaps.

This is the technical core of Bálint's proof.

title: Lorch's Generalizations
content:
**Extensions (Lorch 1976):**

1. Higher derivatives f⁽ᵏ⁾ have analogous properties
2. Related monotonicity for other polynomial families

The original result extends broadly.

title: erdos_1114_summary
content:
**Complete Summary:**

Erdős Problem #1114 is **SOLVED**.

**STATEMENT:** Critical point gaps increase outward from midpoint for AP-root polynomials.

**PROOF:** Bálint (1960)

**KEY INSIGHT:** Symmetry + convexity establish monotonicity.
